title: Rostov
summary: Rostov (Russian: Ростов, IPA: [rɐˈstof]) is a town in Yaroslavl Oblast, Russia, one of the oldest in the country and a tourist center of the Golden Ring. It is located on the shores of Lake Nero, 202 kilometers (126 mi) northeast of Moscow. Population: 31,792 (2010 Census);[3] 34,141 (2002 Census);[8] 35,707 (1989 Census).[9]
